stimulusHtml: Two closed containers, X and Y, each contain a sample of an ideal gas and are brought into thermal contact, as shown, and the system is isolated from the surroundings. Container Y is initially at a higher temperature than Container X. Which of the following is a correct claim about the two-container system after the two containers are brought into thermal contact?
choicesHtml: The two containers reach thermal equilibrium at the same entropy state as when they first came into contact.
The two containers reach thermal equilibrium with the system at lower entropy.
The two containers reach thermal equilibrium with the system at higher entropy.
The two containers cannot reach thermal equilibrium because the system is closed to the environment.
